intro: Desmopsis biseriata, commonly known as the two-rowed desmopsis, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, showy flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has woody stems with a rough, fissured bark. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, with five petals and a prominent, spurred corona. Desmopsis biseriata is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to arid environments.
